description: On March 20, 2020, Cuba decided not to close schools as of yet, but the education sector has taken measures to strengthen the hygiene and care of those who are in its facilities. Update: this policy ended March 24, 2020, when Cuba closed down all schools.
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)
type_sub_cat: Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
institution_status: Preschool or childcare facilities allowed to open with no conditions
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The Ministry of Education announced that starting on March 30th, 2020, a TV transmission of an educational program will begin in tv channels as part of the implementation of the decisions of the Government in the confrontation with COVID-19. The Educational Channel will begin its programming at 8:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m. On Mondays and Fridays, it will be with the school billboard and a complementary program (la cartelera escolar y un programa complementario), while on Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays, there will be reviews for the Higher Education entrance exams. The programming of this channel includes emissions from the primary level to the Pedagogical Training.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
institution_status: Preschool or childcare facilities closed/locked down
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: "Cuba’s government said on Monday it was banning Cubans from leaving the country, closing schools and suspending interregional public transport in its fight to prevent the spread of the novel coronavirus." - after Mar. 24 UPDATE: Schools were going to be closed until April 20th,2020, however, Cuba announced that schools were closed indefinitely. Due to the behavior of COVID-19 in the country, it will not be possible to resume the school year from April 20 as planned and, therefore, television teaching programming will continue, in a second stage, to contribute to the preparation of the students, as reported this Friday at the Ena Elsa Velzquez Cobiella Round Table, Minister of Education.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description: Cuba school outbreak closes Ciego de Avila schools. small outbreak of COVID-19 cases has prompted authorities to re-close schools in a central Cuban province only a week after they opened. Ciego de Avila schools director said 75 of the provinces 90 schools would return to televised teaching on 7 September. Students had returned to classrooms only on September 1 after a six-month break.

description: Since January 14,  34 municipalities faced closure of schools ( and returned to the TV transmission stage). The minister of education announced schools will only return once the epidemiological situation allows them to do so. She announced that news that said schools would be returning to in-person on February 20 were misinformed and fake news.

description: In the territories with community transmission, schools are still closed  and students are using virtual means to receive classes (TV, internet). In other territories, schools are open, following measures of distance, disinfection, ventilation, use of masks, among others.  From March 15, “all students living in the territories in the phase of limited autochthonous transmission will equally receive teaching activities through the Educational Channel, except Pinar del Río, which will continue with its teaching through Tele Pinar.”  “there is a stop on the road, in the transmission of television teaching activities and the next two weeks will be consolidation, with space reserved for a new exercise by subject, which will allow each student and their family to carry out a self-assessment of the learning and knowledge acquired during this stage”. Also in March, broadcasts will be expanded to include a significant number of subjects not yet included in the television programming.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
institution_status: Preschool or childcare facilities allowed to open with conditions
institution_conditions: Regular cleaning and sanitary procedures applied to classrooms (e.g. classrooms must be aired out after each class)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: For the culmination of the 2020-2021 school year and the beginning of 2021-2022, three scenarios were planned:  - Favorable: Those territories and institutions that have not stopped the school year and culminate in July 2021 and begin in September of this year the next academic year 2021-2022, such as Las Tunas, some municipalities of Cienfuegos and Holguín, as well as some rural schools .  - Less favorable: It includes the affected territories, which could resume the course between the months of June and July, culminating on January 22 of next year, and begin the course nine days later.  - Critical: Territories with the greatest impacts that will resume the current school year in September 2021 and end on January 22, 2022, with 19 weeks. Likewise, they start the next course on January 31, 2022. They are the territories of Pinar del Río, Artemisa, Havana, Mayabeque, Matanzas, Sancti Spíritus, Granma and Santiago de Cuba, which have marked the pulse of the pandemic in the Antillean nation.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
institution_status: Preschool or childcare facilities allowed to open with conditions
institution_conditions: Other conditions not listed above (please provide detail in the text entry)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
In Cuba a "patient undergoes a rapid test, which allows specialists to learn in less than 30 minutes if people have been or not infected.

In case of testing positive for Covid-19, the real-time PCR test is also implemented, which has a very small margin of error, Duran said.

If patient is positive, 15 days after being admitted with treatment, and if he shows a favorable clinical progress, the real-time PCR test is repeated." after Apr. 3
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: In the new protocol (May) it is stated that contacts from suspect cases will be admitted to an isolation centre for 14 days (see pages 13 and 15, 2.1.3)   Also, in the daily report by the Ministry of Health, the new cases are individually identified, and the number of contacts being monitored for each of them is recorded.

description:
Cuba implements "strict quarantine measures [...] in areas of Havana and Pinar del Río [...], to prevent further spread of coronavirus (COVID-19) in the country. [...] Under the quarantine orders, no one is allowed to enter or exit the designated area except for those with a safe-conduct pass."  after Apr. 3. 
UPDATE: Starting in June 18, Cuba is implementing a recovery plan in all provinces except  La Habana and Matanzas UPDATE: Cuba started the recovery plan after COVID-19
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more cities within one or more countries

description: "Cuba’s Minister of Internal Trade Betsy Díaz Velázquez and Minister of Transportation Eduardo Rodríguez announced April 9 that, starting on April 11, most public urban, rural, and intra-municipal transportation will be suspended and most commercial spaces will close down. Only authorized transportation will operate at 50 percent capacity for essential workers and people heading to health appointments or other emergency situations, while stores will only sell food and essential items."
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Cuba suspends public transportation as of April 11

description: Cuba "declared that the country had entered a phase of “limited local transmission.” Under this phase, the Defense Councils across the country will set up quarantines in neighborhoods or municipalities with suspected or confirmed local transmission." after Apr. 7
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: "Cuban officials will begin distributing doses of PrevengHo-Vir, a Cuban-manufactured homeopathic remedy, to the elderly and other vulnerable populations as a way to combat the spread within the country. The drug “increases resistance, the body’s defenses against a certain virus,” according to Francisco Durán, who heads epidemiology at the Health Ministry." approx. between Apr.1-7
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_text: The government will distribute a drug to vulnerable populations
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Cuba is expanding the expiration date of medicine prescriptions so people don't have to go to the hospital to get a new prescription to buy their controlled medicines.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_text: Cuba is expanding the expiration date of medicine prescriptions so people (mostly, elderly) don't have to go to the hospital to get a new prescription to buy their controlled medicines (regular and unrelated to COVID medicines).
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Cuba will carry out the university admission process to the 2020-2021 academic year when the epidemiological situation of the country allows it. Admission exams will be held thirty days after activities resumption.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
type_text: It is a change to Cuba's universities schedules - particularly the admission process.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Cuba is changing the academic calendar schedule to finish the 2019-2020 academic year and to proper start the 2020-2021 academic year.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
type_text: It is a chance in the academic calendar - particularly, a reorganization of the calendar.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: "Cuba's Health Ministry has even posted a video online advising Cubans how to make their own masks." after Mar. 16

description: In Cuba "isolation for surveillance for 14 days will be applied to all travelers residing in the country in the institutions authorized by the Ministry of Public Health if they presents symptoms.This sanitary measure is of strict compliance after Mar. 20".
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: In Cuba, "tourists staying in hotels will be confined to those hotels until it is time for them to depart. They cannot leave the hotel unless to go to the aiport. All excursions are suspended. A medic will visit the hotel twice per day. Tourists can only move around for essential trips and in officially authorised and licensed transport, e.g. yellow taxis for trips to the airport to catch their flight. Tourists can no longer rent cars." after Mar.23
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Quarantine outside the home or government facility (i.e. quarantine in a hotel)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
travel_mechanism: All kinds of transport (all below except visa restrictions)

description:
In Cuba "The Pinar del Río government decreed quarantine for the El Canal People’s Council, in the municipality of Consolación del Sur, after learning of a new case of local transmission of the coronavirus that causes COVID-19. This is the first community in Cuba that is isolated due to the epidemic." after Apr. 1
UPDATE:  "Violating the sanitary provisions established in the middle of the epidemic of coronavirus, which causes COVID-19, constitutes a crime according to Chapter 5 of the current Penal Code" after Mar. 31
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Other Quarantine
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: Cuba announced " a series of measures aimed at protecting workers, including that workers who must undergo a 14-day isolation period will receive 100 percent of their basic salary for the time period. Older and at-risk workers were instructed to stay home and will receive 100 percent of their basic salary for the first month and 60 percent thereafter." after Apr. 7
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Cuba is enforcing that "only cuban resident are allowed to enter the country, with flexibility to ensure cooperation with some countries.Applies for 30 days." Additionally Cuba is "increasing staff capacity.". Half of the restaurants are being closed. Campings, hotels, cinemas and theatres are as well being closed. Implementation of strong social protection to avoid unemployment. All measures taken by the government but described in public media.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description: "Cuba’s government has suspended its May Day Parade, a fixture of the country’s calendar since the 1959 revolution, due to fears that it could promote the spread of the novel coronavirus, reports dpa news." - Apr. 1
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)

description: Cuba startet social distancuing by making "people keeping a sensible distance away from each other, limiting movement in public spaces" after Mar. 30
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description: In the territories with community transmission, schools are still closed  and students are using virtual means to receive classes (TV, internet). In other territories, schools are open, following measures of distance, disinfection, ventilation, use of masks, among others.  From March 15, “all students living in the territories in the phase of limited autochthonous transmission will equally receive teaching activities through the Educational Channel, except Pinar del Río, which will continue with its teaching through Tele Pinar.”  “there is a stop on the road, in the transmission of television teaching activities and the next two weeks will be consolidation, with space reserved for a new exercise by subject, which will allow each student and their family to carry out a self-assessment of the learning and knowledge acquired during this stage”. Also in March, broadcasts will be expanded to include a significant number of subjects not yet included in the television programming.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
